entries.text:
The durability of the AC.
This is the total AP value of all frame parts.

Defense rating against kinetic damage.
This is the total anti-kinetic defense value of all frame parts.

Defense rating against energy damage.
This is the total anti-energy defense value of all frame parts.

Defense rating against explosive/incendiary damage.
This is the total anti-explosive defense value of all frame parts.

The maximum load the ACS (Attitude Control System) can support.
This is the total attitude stability value of all frame parts.
The higher the value, the less likely the AC is to stagger.

The ability of the ACS to manage strain.
Lighter overall weight increases this value, leading to faster recovery from residual impact.

Target tracking performance during lock-on.
The higher this value, the more likely you are to land shots on moving enemies.
The Firearm Specialization spec of arm parts contributes to this value.

Maximum speed during boost movement.
Higher booster thrust and lower overall weight of the AC contribute to this value.

Initial speed of Quick Boost.
Higher Quick Boost thrust and lower overall weight of the AC contribute to this value.

Amount of EN consumed when using Quick Boost.
EN consumption is reduced when using boosters with a lower Quick Boost EN consumption spec and cores with a higher Booster Efficiency Adjustment spec.

Reload time for Quick Boost.
Lower values enable agile, consecutive Quick Boost usage.
Reload time is compromised if the overall weight of the AC exceeds the booster's QB Reload Ideal Weight spec.

Total amount of EN available for use.
Higher values enable heavy use of EN-consuming actions.

Rate at which EN is supplied to the AC.
Higher values enable faster EN recovery.
Improved by the EN Output spec of the generator and influenced by the total EN load of the AC, with lighter assemblies recovering EN more quickly.

Duration of the delay before EN is recharged.
The lower the value, the more quickly EN recovers after an EN-consuming action.
Improved by generators with a higher EN Recharge spec and cores with a higher Generator Supply Adjustment spec.

Cost of repairs to the AC.
This value is affected proportionately by the total damage taken from mission start to mission end.

Total weight of all AC parts.
Calculated as the sum of the weight of all individual parts.
Influences movement speed of the AC.

Arm load weight.
Calculated as the sum of the weight of the individual weapons on both arms.

Maximum weight arms can carry without compromising on stable operating performance.
Higher values make it easier to manipulate arm weapons, mitigating dips in target tracking and recoil control caused by overload.

Body load weight.
Calculated as the total weight of all parts, excluding the leg unit.

Maximum weight legs can support.
Higher values improve capacity, enabling installation of multiple heavy parts.

EN load of the AC.
Calculated as the sum of the EN load of all parts.
The AC cannot sortie if this value exceeds the generator's EN output.

EN output of the AC.
Higher values mean that the generator can support more high-burden parts, with the leftover output improving EN recovery speed.
Improved by generators with a higher EN Output spec and cores with a higher Generator Output Adjustment spec.
Average defense rating against the various damage types.

Total load as a proportion of the maximum load.
The AC cannot sortie if this value exceeds the limit. (The OS upgrade Weight Control can bypass this restriction.)

Weight of both hand weapons as a proportion of the maximum arm load.
Exceeding the limit will result in diminished target tracking and recoil control.

EN load as a proportion of EN output.
The AC cannot sortie if this value exceeds the limit.
Weapon type: Semi-Auto One round is fired each time the trigger is pulled.
Weapon type: Burst Multiple rounds are fired each time the trigger is pulled.
Weapon type: Charge Behavior of rounds changes when the trigger is held down.
Weapon type: Full-Auto Rounds are continuously fired when the trigger is held down.
Multiple rounds are fired in bursts when the trigger is held down.
Weapon type: Homing Pull the trigger after lock-on completes to track the enemy.
Weapon type: Melee Pull the trigger to perform a melee attack.
Weapon type: Shield Hold down the trigger to deploy the shield.
Reload type: Magazine Reloading occurs when the magazine is consumed.
Reload type: Single Shot Reloading occurs every time a round is fired.
Reload type: Overheat The weapon heats up with use, and overheat occurs when tolerance is exceeded.
Attack type: Kinetic Inflicts physical damage.
Additional effect: Shock Electrocutes the enemy. When the enemy's tolerance is exceeded, a forced discharge of electricity occurs, causing additional damage.
Additional effect: ACS Failure Causes enemy ACS to overheat. Once the heat tolerance of the ACS is exceeded, stability is dramatically reduced for a short time.
Additional effect: Camera Disruption Impairs enemy cameras, hindering lock-on capabilities. This effect also applies to your own AC and allied ACs.
Attack type: Energy Inflicts energy-based damage.

Inflicts energy-based damage.
Additional effect: Electrocutes the enemy. When the enemy's tolerance is exceeded, a forced discharge of electricity occurs, causing additional damage.

Inflicts energy-based damage.
Additional effect: Interferes with the enemy's ACS. When the enemy's tolerance is exceeded, stability is dramatically reduced for a short time.

Inflicts energy-based damage.
Additional effect: Inhibits functionality of the target's cameras, hindering lock-on capabilities. This effect also applies to your own AC and allied ACs.
Attack type: Explosive Inflicts explosive/incendiary damage.

Inflicts explosive/incendiary damage.
Additional effect: Electrocutes the enemy. When the enemy's tolerance is exceeded, a forced discharge of electricity occurs, causing additional damage.

Inflicts explosive/incendiary damage.
Additional effect: Interferes with the enemy's ACS. When the enemy's tolerance is exceeded, stability is dramatically reduced for a short time.

Inflicts explosive/incendiary damage.
Additional effect: Inhibits functionality of the target's cameras, hindering lock-on capabilities. This effect also applies to your own AC and allied ACs.
Attack type: Coral Inflicts Coral-based damage.

Inflicts Coral-based damage.
Additional effect: Electrocutes the enemy. When the enemy's tolerance is exceeded, a forced discharge of electricity occurs, causing additional damage.

Inflicts Coral-based damage.
Additional effect: Interferes with the enemy's ACS. When the enemy's tolerance is exceeded, stability is dramatically reduced for a short time.

Inflicts Coral-based damage.
Additional effect: Inhibits functionality of the target's cameras, hindering lock-on capabilities. This effect also applies to your own AC and allied ACs.

Inflicts special damage.
Additional effect: Electrocutes the enemy. When the enemy's tolerance is exceeded, a forced discharge of electricity occurs, causing additional damage.

Inflicts special damage.
Additional effect: Interferes with the enemy's ACS. When the enemy's tolerance is exceeded, stability is dramatically reduced for a short time.

Inflicts special damage.
Additional effect: Inhibits functionality of the target's cameras, hindering lock-on capabilities. This effect also applies to your own AC and allied ACs.

<?partsSpecIcon@10?>Weapon type: Semi-Auto One round is fired each time the trigger is pulled. <?partsSpecIcon@11?>Weapon type: Full-Auto Rounds are continuously fired when the trigger is held down. <?partsSpecIcon@12?>Weapon type: Burst Multiple rounds are fired each time the trigger is pulled. <?partsSpecIcon@13?>Weapon type: Charge Behavior of rounds changes when the trigger is held down. <?partsSpecIcon@14?>Weapon type: Homing Pull the trigger after lock-on completes to track the enemy. <?partsSpecIcon@15?>Weapon type: Melee Pull the trigger to perform a melee attack. <?partsSpecIcon@16?>Weapon type: Shield Hold down the trigger to deploy the shield.

<?partsSpecIcon@21?>Reload type: Single Shot Reloading occurs every time a round is fired. <?partsSpecIcon@20?>Reload type: Magazine Reloading occurs when the magazine is consumed. <?partsSpecIcon@22?>Reload type: Overheat The weapon heats up with use, and overheat occurs when tolerance is exceeded.

<?partsSpecIcon@0?>Attack type: Kinetic Inflicts physical damage. <?partsSpecIcon@2?>Attack type: Explosive Inflicts explosive/incendiary damage. <?partsSpecIcon@1?>Attack type: Energy Inflicts energy-based damage. <?partsSpecIcon@3?>Attack type: Coral Inflicts Coral-based damage.

<?partsSpecIcon@30?>Additional effect: Camera Disruption Impairs enemy cameras, hindering lock-on capabilities. <?partsSpecIcon@31?>Additional effect: Shock When the enemy's tolerance is exceeded, a forced discharge of electricity occurs, causing additional damage. <?partsSpecIcon@32?>Additional effect: ACS Failure Interferes with the enemy's ACS, greatly reducing stability if tolerance is exceeded.
Specialization: Physical Shields Enhanced destructiveness against enemy physical shields.

Damage-dealing performance.
Damage output can decrease due to factors such as attenuation over distance, or when ricocheting occurs.
Damage multiplier when attacking a staggered enemy.

ACS overload performance.
This corresponds to immediate ACS strain, which resets within a short period of time.

Accumulative ACS overload performance.
This corresponds to sustained ACS strain, which is alleviated over time.

Ability to interfere with enemy pulse barriers.
The higher this value, the easier it is to break down pulse armor or shielding.

Damage-dealing performance for charge attacks.
Damage output can decrease due to factors such as attenuation over distance, or when ricocheting occurs.

Damage-dealing performance for full-charge attacks.
Damage output can decrease due to factors such as attenuation over distance, or when ricocheting occurs.
Damage multiplier when attacking a staggered enemy with a charge attack.
Damage multiplier when attacking a staggered enemy with a full-charge attack.

ACS overload performance for charge attacks.
This corresponds to immediate ACS strain, which resets within a short period of time.

ACS overload performance for full-charge attacks.
This corresponds to immediate ACS strain, which resets within a short period of time.

Accumulative ACS overload performance for charge attacks.
This corresponds to sustained ACS strain, which is alleviated over time.

Accumulative ACS overload performance for full-charge attacks.
This corresponds to sustained ACS strain, which is alleviated over time.

EN load when charging.
EN is reduced if this value exceeds supply.
The time it takes to complete charging.
The time it takes to reach full charge.

Heat buildup when attacking.
Overheat occurs when value exceeds the maximum tolerance.

Heat buildup when using charge attacks.
Overheat occurs when value exceeds the maximum tolerance.

Heat buildup when using full-charge attacks.
Overheat occurs when value exceeds the maximum tolerance.
Speed at which heat buildup is reduced when cooling weapon.
Speed at which heat buildup is reduced when cooling weapon from an overheated state.

Speed of rapid fire.
This is the number of rounds that can be fired within 1 second.
Total number of rounds that can be fired.
Number of rounds loaded per magazine.
Time from start to completion of reload.
Tracking performance of missiles and other homing weapons.

Time it takes to acquire lock-on for missiles and other homing weapons.
Achieve optimal tracking performance by keeping enemies in your sights for this duration.

Maximum possible number of lock-ons for missiles and other homing weapons.
Multi-lock is possible if this number is 2 or higher.
Precision of fire centered on the reticule.

Range at which attack power is guaranteed without ricocheting.
Applies regardless of the target's defenses, with the exception of some special armor.

Range at which attacks are effective.
This is based on the armor of standard ACs and can vary depending on the defenses of the target.
Maximum range at which rounds retain their attack power.

Cost per round fired.
At the end of each mission, the total number of rounds fired is used to calculate ammunition expenses.
Ability to mitigate incoming damage while performing a regular guard.
Ability to mitigate incoming ACS burden while performing a regular guard.
Ability to mitigate incoming damage while performing an Initial Guard.
Damage mitigation for attacks caught by guard while shield is in an idle state.
Ability to mitigate ACS strain while performing an Initial Guard.
ACS strain mitigation for attacks caught by guard while shield is in an idle state.
Duration of the Initial Guard damage mitigation window.
Area in which shield is capable of blocking attacks.

Heat buildup when deploying shield.
Overheat occurs when value exceeds the maximum tolerance.
Speed at which heat buildup is reduced when cooling shield.
Speed at which heat buildup is reduced when cooling shield from an overheated state.

Damage-dealing performance.
Influenced by additional inputs and other factors.

ACS overload performance.
This corresponds to immediate ACS strain, which resets within a short period of time.
Influenced by additional inputs and other factors.

Accumulative ACS overload performance.
This corresponds to sustained ACS strain, which is alleviated over time.
Influenced by additional inputs and other factors.
Number of chain attacks possible with additional inputs.

Attack type of charge attacks.
Final damage is increased or attenuated depending on the enemy's defense ratings against various damage types.

ACS overload performance for charge attacks.
This corresponds to immediate ACS strain, which resets within a short period of time.

Accumulative ACS overload performance for charge attacks.
This corresponds to sustained ACS strain, which is alleviated over time.
Number of chain attacks possible with additional inputs following a charge attack.
Size of explosions resulting from charge attacks.
Size of explosions resulting from full-charge attacks.

Ability to track enemies.
The higher this value, the more likely attacks are to hit.
Number of times Core Expansion functionality can be activated.

Damage-dealing performance.
Damage attenuates over distance.

ACS overload performance.
This corresponds to immediate ACS strain, which resets within a short period of time.

Range corresponding to the furthest reach of explosions.
Power and impact of the explosion are reduced at this range, but enemy fire is still cancelled out.

Range corresponding to the direct impact of explosions.
Power and impact of explosions reach their full potential within this range, and enemy fire is cancelled out.
Average defense rating against the various damage types.

The maximum load the ACS can support.
The higher this value, the less likely the AC is to stagger.

Ability to detect system abnormalities and recover.
Higher values correspond to lower vulnerability to system abnormalities.

Camera stability against electronic countermeasures.
Higher values correspond to mitigation of lock-on range reduction effects resulting from camera disruption.
Frontal angle within which scanning can detect enemies or part containers.
Range within which scanning can detect enemies or part containers.
Scan visibility duration after having detected enemies or part containers.

Adjustment to booster EN efficiency.
The higher this value, the less EN consumed by Quick Boost.

Adjustment to generator EN output.
The higher this value, the greater the final EN output of the generator.

Capacity of sub-tanks connected to the generator.
This value is added to EN capacity.

Adjustment to generator EN supply performance.
The higher this value, the more quickly the generator resumes supply after an EN-consuming action.

Maximum weight arms can carry without compromising on stable operating performance.
Higher values make it easier to manipulate arm weapons, mitigating dips in target tracking and recoil control caused by overload.

Ability to absorb recoil.
Higher values mitigate accuracy reduction incurred by rapid fire.

Suitability for using firearms.
Higher values improve target tracking performance.

Suitability for using melee weapons.
Higher values correspond to greater attack power.

Maximum weight legs can support.
Higher values mean that the legs can support more heavy parts.

Braking performance for movement actions.
The higher this value, the shorter the distance required for braking.
Walking speed while boost is disengaged.
Pivot turning speed of caterpillar treads. This parameter only applies to tank leg units.

Horizontal jumping performance.
Higher values correspond to higher initial speed of Quick Boosts from the ground.

Vertical jumping performance.
Higher values correspond to higher maximum heights of jumps from the ground.

Range at which lock-on operates.
Target tracking is active for targets within this range.

Precision with which lock-on tracks targets.
The higher this value, the easier it is for the reticle to align with moving targets.

Modifier for the time it takes to acquire lock-on for missiles and other homing weapons.
The higher the value, the less time required to complete lock-on.

Modifier for the time it takes to acquire multiple lock-ons for missiles and other homing weapons.
The higher the value, the less time required to complete lock-ons.

Aiming assistance performance at close range.
Higher values improve aim when targeting enemies at close range (within 130 m).

Aiming assistance performance at medium range.
Higher values improve aim when targeting enemies at medium range (130–260 m).

Aiming assistance performance at long range.
Higher values improve aim when targeting enemies at long range (beyond 260 m).

Generator EN output.
Higher values mean that the generator can support more high-burden parts, with the leftover output improving EN recovery speed.

Total amount of EN available for use.
Higher values enable heavy use of EN-consuming actions.

The ability of the generator to initiate EN recharge.
The higher this value, the more quickly the generator commences recovery after an EN-consuming action.

The ability of the generator to recover after interruption of EN supply.
The higher this value, the more quickly the generator commences recovery after EN is fully depleted.

Amount of EN that is immediately recharged after generator EN supply has been restored.
Higher values correspond to greater initial EN recharge after the generator recovers from complete EN depletion, enabling heavy use of EN-consuming actions following recovery.

Efficiency of EN output diverted to ranged energy weapons.
Higher values correspond to greater attack power and reduced charging time for weapons affected by this spec.
This spec does not affect weapons with independent EN output systems, such as melee weapons or plasma missile launchers.

Thrust of boost movement.
Higher values correspond to greater movement speed.

Vertical thrust of boost movement.
Higher values correspond to greater ascending speed.
EN consumed by ascending boost movement.

Initial thrust of Quick Boost movement.
Higher values correspond to greater initial speed.

Duration of Quick Boost jets.
Higher values correspond to greater distance traveled.

Reload time for Quick Boost.
Lower values enable agile, consecutive usage.

Thrust of Assault Boost movement.
Higher values correspond to swifter rush attacks.

Maximum tolerable AC weight before Quick Boost reload time is compromised.
Higher values can support heavier ACs without suffering reduced performance.

Thrust when homing in on enemies using melee weapons.
Most melee weapons are capable of homing in on enemies within certain ranges. This value increases the speed of those homing attacks.
EN consumed by movement resulting from use of melee weapon.
